bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, November 3, 1939

div1.p: Hench sends Moran the book "Death Loses a Pair of Wings," concerning William C. Gorgas.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, November 3, 1939
div1.opener:
November 3, 1939
Mr. John J. Moran
c/o Cia Sunoco de Cuba, S. A.
Avenida Monocal Nos. 455-57
Habana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
I am enroute to New York from where I will send you
(if my mind doesn't close in on me and I forget it) a copy of a book
just out--DEATH LOSES A PAIR OF WINGS, The Epic of William Gorgas and
the Conquest of Yellow Fever, by Robin Lampson. It has had some very
good book reviews. The last fourth of the book concerns Reed's work,
and presumably is more or less of a daily diary.

You will note that Kean enters the picture seriously
on September 5, 1900, and you and Kissinger enter the picture on the
twentieth of November (see page 468).

Before I visit you in Havana next March, I should
appreciate it very much indeed if you would look over this book, and if
possible, make brief notes on what is true and what is fiction. If you
have time to drop me some comments on this, I shall appreciate it very
much. Otherwise, we can talk about it in Havana. No matter how much
is truth in it, I am sure you will be interested in it, and I should
like you to have it from me.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
